Adversity.Quote: Time is like a river made up of the events which happen, and a violent stream; for as soon as a thing has been seen, it is carried away, and another comes in its place, and this will be carried away too.
Adversity.Author: Marcus Aurelius

Adversity.Quote: Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future too.
Adversity.Author: Marcus Aurelius

Adversity.Quote: No great thing is created suddenly, any more than a bunch of grapes or a fig. If you tell me that you desire a fig, I answer that there must be time. Let it first blossom, then bear fruit, then ripen.
Adversity.Author: Seneca

Adversity.Quote: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man without trials.
Adversity.Author: Seneca

Adversity.Quote: It’s not because things are difficult that we dare not venture. It’s because we dare not venture that they are difficult.
Adversity.Author: Seneca

Adversity.Quote: Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible for anyone to accomplish.
Adversity.Author: Marcus Aurelius

Adversity.Quote: Difficulty shows what men are. Therefore when a difficulty falls upon you, remember that God, like a trainer of wrestlers, has matched you with a rough young man. Why? So that you may become an Olympic conqueror, but it is not accomplished without sweat.
Adversity.Author: Epictetus

Adversity.Quote: You shouldn't give circumstances the power to rouse anger, for they don't care at all.
Adversity.Author: Marcus Aurelius

Adversity.Quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
Adversity.Author: Seneca

Adversity.Quote: Dig deep within yourself, for there is a foundation of goodness every ready to flow if you will keep digging
Adversity.Author: Marcus Aurelius

Mortality.Quote: To live the good life: We have the potential for it. If we can learn to be indifferent to what makes no difference.
Mortality.Author: Marcus Aurelius

Mortality.Quote: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
Mortality.Author: Seneca

Mortality.Quote: Silence is the lesson learned from the many sufferings of life.
Mortality.Author: Seneca

Mortality.Quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
Mortality.Author: Marcus Aurelius

Mental Wellness.Quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
Mental Wellness.Author: Seneca

Mental Wellness.Quote: The mind that is anxious about future events is miserable.
Mental Wellness.Author: Seneca

Mental Wellness.Quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
Mental Wellness.Author: Marcus Aurelius

Mental Wellness.Quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality
Mental Wellness.Author: Seneca

Mental Wellness.Quote: A real man doesn't give way to anger & discontent & such a person has strength, courage & endurance unlike the angry and complaining.
Mental Wellness.Author: Marcus Aurelius
